programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi test a bidding strategy, while Darrell and Brandon are under pressure to find merchandise for their website.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys are shocked when a seller claims to own a cover for a thermo-nuclear warhead. Plus, a mandolin from Bob Wills' Texas Playboys shows up.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The shop opens its doors on vintage Aerosmith tour shirts and a US Navy foghorn. Corey examines a state-of-the-art survival vehicle built to fight zombies.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A man tries to sell a series of poorly stuffed animals, leading to to an unusual threat being made against Les.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A woman sells an artistic statue of an old woman in a bathing suit, but when Les buys it, Seth blames Ashley for contributing to the purchase.

programme.title: Cajun Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A client offers the team a cannon that was used in an infamous massacre, while Jimmie is tempted by a jacket made out of bison leather.

programme.title: Cajun Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Jimmie haggles over the price of a rare antique weapon - a sword with a built-in pistol. The guys are also offered an unusual toy horse and bullets from the American Civil War.

programme.title: Stan Lee's Superhumans
programme.desc: The Spider-Man co-creator meets a man who is prepared to put 22 scorpions in his mouth.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: How police were baffled when the bodies of fortune teller Ha Jade Smith and her daughter Anita Vo were found with white paint covering their head and hands.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: Vehicles for hire are the theme in this episode, with a classic London taxi up against a stretch limo.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les remains in hospital following his collapse, and Seth and Ashley continue manning operations at the pawn shop. However, the bickering continues.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth ignores Ashley's wish to ban a troublesome customer - but his decision threatens to put the shop at risk. Meanwhile, Les commissions a striking masterpiece.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth hatches a plan to get more customers through the pawn shop doors. His new idea backfires, and Les is forced to reconsider his choice of manager.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les's return proves a shock for Seth and Ashley, who have let profits drop in his absence. Back in charge, the manager cuts a deal that could increase profits.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley questions whether the pawn store has a thief in its midst when two teens come in with news of a scam.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley buys a 1950s Eljer toilet for $10, leading to Seth to purchase it for double the price in order that he can destroy it with a sledgehammer and storm out of the store.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba's nemesis Kenny Stowe shows up at tense auctions in Mesquite, where struggling Victor proves he is desperate for bargains.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Lesa Lewis and Jerry Simpson compete against Jenny Grumbles and Mary Padian at an auction on their own turf in Longview.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: An English bidder turns up at Fort Worth. Victor acquires some spy equipment, while Ricky and Bubba have their eyes on something far more dangerous.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba plan to get revenge on a rival at an auction in Dallas, and arguments erupt surrounding a musical instrument.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Mary shows a different side to her personality in Dallas and soon has a roaring crowd on its feet. Meanwhile, Ricky and Bubba are led astray by their latest find.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Fort Worth witnesses a showdown when Cowboy Matt begins throwing his weight around. Jenny's wins a locker containing a very strange item.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Revisit the best items ever seen outside of the shop, including Rick's international trip to London where he finds some rare American maps, a vintage piano used by the Rat Pack and an exclusive tour of a Soviet fighter jet..

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: When a draft of the original Star Wars script comes into the shop, Rick and Chum do everything they can to get this 'Obi-one of a kind' collectors' item.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys uncover a Miami Dolphins souvenir from the team's very beginnings, and meet a customer who claims to have unseen footage of President Franklin D Roosevelt.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys try to make a deal over a valuable teddy bear, a 19th-century pistol and a Second World War gas mask.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team values a baseball bat signed by three famous players, a motor racing suit once worn by Paul Newman, and a rare poster of Jimi Hendrix.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys are offered a Second World War pilot's jacket and a piece of the Apollo 11 spacecraft, and try to determine if J Edgar Hoover's signature in a book is genuine.

programme.title: Pirate Treasure of the Knights Templar
programme.desc: A priceless relic of a statue of Christ unearthed on a shipwreck in Madagascar launches dive expert Barry Clifford and historian Scott Wolter on a worldwide investigation to find out if there is a link between two of history's most legendary sects - 17th-century pirates and the medieval Knights Templar.

programme.title: Pirate Treasure of the Knights Templar
programme.desc: Scott Wolter follows the trail of the legendary Knights Templar to Portugal, where he learns some stunning new information that breaks the investigation wide open. Meanwhile, in Madagascar, Barry Clifford switches the team's focus to a wreck he believes is Captain Kidd's warship - and makes a groundbreaking discovery.

programme.title: Pirate Treasure of the Knights Templar
programme.desc: Barry Clifford and Scott Wolter learn the meaning behind one of the symbols on the prized metal ingot they think once belonged to Captain Kidd, leading them one step closer to a Templar-Pirate connection - and unearthing lost treasure.

programme.title: Pirate Treasure of the Knights Templar
programme.desc: Scott Wolter acquires a piece of Captain's Kidd's treasure, launching him to Madagascar, where the trail leads to an ancient Templar fortress that holds valuable clues. Just up the coast, in Pirate Bay, Barry Clifford's team discovers a new shipwreck they believe might be a Templar vessel.

programme.title: Pirate Treasure of the Knights Templar
programme.desc: The trail leads to India where Barry Clifford checks out an island that may contain the most fabled Templar treasure - the Flaming Cross of Goa.

programme.title: Pirate Treasure of the Knights Templar
programme.desc: Barry Clifford takes a final shot at digging up lost Templar treasure, while Scott Wolter uncovers an important relic that may be a link to the Templar-Pirate connection.

programme.title: Conspiracy Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Investigating the plans and goals of the world's most secretive organisations, considering whether elite groups of power players could be plotting the fate of the world.

programme.title: Conspiracy Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: An insight into the secrets surrounding the 10 biggest and most mysterious conspiracies in history, including the goings-on at Area 51.

programme.title: Superheroes Decoded
programme.desc: Part one of two. A look at how comic-book characters took over mainstream culture, dominating the box office and becoming part of the global zeitgeist.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: James Acaster, Angela Barnes, Kerry Godliman, Nish Kumar and Glenn Moore join host Dara O Briain and regular participant Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Match of the Day presenter Gary Lineker takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedian Tom Allen and political commentator Ayesha Hazarika joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: An extended edition of the quiz show, in which question-master Stephen Fry muddles through the middle show of the middle series as comedians Jimmy Carr, Aisling Bea and Danny Bhoy compete alongside resident panellist Alan Davies. As usual, points are awarded for the answers the host finds most interesting, regardless of whether or not they are correct.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the domestic comedy which sees the couple appear to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and their world-weary friends Toby and Anna. This week the couple become addicted to a TV box set, causing them to cancel dinner with Toby and Anna at the last moment. But when they lie about the reason, it only succeeds in opening up a huge can of worms. Domestic comedy, with Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy are trying to make the family healthier, so they are not too happy about the school lollipop man handing out sweets to the kids. Domestic comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the domestic comedy which sees the couple appear to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and their world-weary friends Toby and Anna. In this final episode, Lucy begins to consider having a breast augmentation, encouraged by Anna, wondering whether it will help her regain some of the femininity she felt in her youth. With Abigail Cruttenden and Hugh Dennis.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Modern Wheels or Classic Steals
programme.desc: Rebecca Jackson and Elo help family man Paul find a new car, choosing between a modern BMW and a classic Mercedes-Benz.

programme.title: Modern Wheels or Classic Steals
programme.desc: Rebecca Jackson and Elo help recently retired Bik find a new car, choosing between a practical family car or a present to himself.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Rival teams of amateur racers pit their wacky, gravity-powered soapbox vehicles in a downhill race against the clock in Paris.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie gets a taste of Cuba in Miami's fresh seafood, sets his sights at a shooting range, and heads cross-state to attempt a huge surf & turf challenge created just for him.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Stoke strongman Eddie Hall visits cosmopolitan Queens, NY, to make a solo attempt at a huge Greek kebab banquet, sample the best Chinese dumplings and try his hand at baseball.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: A selection of the most memorable bargains picked up by the team during the series.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.sub-title: Have Yourself a Merry Pickers Christmas
programme.desc: Mike tries to put Frank in a Christmas mood with two trips in search of precious objects.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: The competing teams' motorless vehicles use gravity as their only form of propulsion in the Belgian capital of Brussels.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Rival teams of amateur racers pit their wacky, gravity-powered soapbox vehicles in a downhill race against the clock in Paris.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Gavin starts his job in Cardiff and, while Stacey is thrilled to be back in Wales, Smithy has to come to terms with living in Essex without his best friend. Nessa has taken up residence in Dave's caravan in Sully and is getting ready for Neil's christening. The event means a big reunion for the gang, at which Smithy receives surprising news from Nessa, and Stacey has a special request for her husband.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Dave is unhappy about Nessa's plans to let Smithy see the baby, while Stacey ensures Gavin sticks to his promise as she tries to find a new job. Meanwhile, Dawn and Pete join Pam and Mick for a beer and curry night. Comedy, starring Joanna Page and Mathew Horne.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Bryn is in his element as he awaits the arrival of the Essex boys, who are having a big night out in Cardiff and staying for a sleepover, but Smithy is concerned about seeing Nessa again after their last meeting. Meanwhile, Stacey tells Gavin about a worrying discovery, and Pam and Mick discuss their plans for a new conservatory.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Everyone gathers in Billericay as Pete and Dawn prepare to renew their wedding vows. Gavin feels uncomfortable about Gwen and Bryn knowing the details of his sex life, and Dave hears about the shocking events of the curry night. Meanwhile, Smithy goes beyond the call of friendship when he makes a staggering suggestion.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Bank Holiday Monday sees the Essex contingent arrive for a sunny day at the beach in Barry. Gavin has a heart-to-heart with his dad, which gives him much to think about, while a dark cloud looms on the horizon when Dave arrives to find Nessa and Smithy enjoying all the fun of the fair. Mathew Horne, Joanna Page, James Corden and Ruth Jones star.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Preparations for Nessa and Dave's wedding are in full swing, Stacey has life-changing news for Gavin, and Bryn and Jason put their big secret to bed once and for all. Finally, the wedding arrives and, as Nessa prepares to make her way to the church, Smithy takes the opportunity to have one last chat. Mathew Horne, Joanna Page, James Corden, Ruth Jones and Rob Brydon star.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: An extraordinary Red Bull Soapbox course at the Yomiuriland Amusement Park in Tokyo. The course includes a unique see-saw feature and a wicked berm.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts the quiz show, asking questions about catastrophes, cosmonauts and coconuts of Bill Bailey, Dara O Briain, Phill Jupitus and Alan Davies.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by actress and presenter Mel Giedroyc, heavyweight boxer David Haye, actor-musician Martin Kemp and comedian Romesh Ranganathan. As usual, the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory and the dubious honour of being dubbed host Rob Brydon's liar of the week.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon presents, as regular team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by one-time Bake Off champion Nadiya Hussain, comic and actor Michael Smiley, and comedians Bob Mortimer and Diane Morgan. As usual, the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory and the dubious honour of being dubbed the liar of the week.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Guests Jessica Hynes, Phill Jupitus and Jo Brand join regular contributor Alan Davies and host Stephen Fry in the quiz show. Subjects under discussion include domesticity - and as usual the questions are so difficult that points are awarded for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: Pulp Fiction (1994)
programme.desc: A series of interlinked stories about the Los Angeles underworld. A hitman plays minder to his boss's wife, and he and his partner deal with a dead body following a mishap with a gun. Meanwhile, a washed-up boxer goes on the run after refusing to throw a fight, and two lovers plot a hold-up in a diner. Quentin Tarantino's crime drama, starring John Travolta, Samuel L Jackson, Uma Thurman, Bruce Willis, Ving Rhames, Tim Roth and Amanda Plummer.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Great Central Railway's Scott Manley takes a rainy busman's holiday working as a guard at Bury, while a team of volunteers in Wales try to keep the line clear of overgrown plants.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story of America's â€˜Liberty Ships', which were produced in incredible numbers and became known as the Model T Fords of the ocean.

programme.title: Royals on the Frontline
programme.desc: The highs and lows of Prince Harry and Prince William's roles in the forces, featuring an interview with Harry in which he discusses a planned secret deployment in Afghanistan.

programme.title: WW2 Price of Empire
programme.desc: Reflections on the final days of the Second World War and the surrender of the Axis powers, including how empires fell and the political map of the world was remade.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Documentary offering an insight into some of the events in the Bible, beginning with the story of the Ten Plagues. In the Old Testament, the Book of Exodus describes the epic battle between the prophet Moses and Pharaoh. Experts offer various various explanations for the 10 plagues of Moses and the mass exodus of the Hebrew slaves out of Egypt, a story that is a cornerstone of the Jewish, Christian, and Muslim faiths.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Investigating the Turin Shroud, which is a length of linen cloth that some believe bears the image of Jesus. Cameras follow the efforts of a scientist trying to prove whether the cloth truly is Christ's burial robe.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The people responsible for tracking down war criminals who had evaded capture, beginning with the US army task force in charge of locating German scientists.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of Hitler's personal secretary Martin Bormann and the efforts to track him down. With insufficient evidence to confirm the Nazi official's death, the International Military Tribunal at Nuremberg tried him in absentia during 1946 and eventually sentenced him to death. Despite extensive efforts, he was never found and was eventually presumed to have died in May 1945.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: How the SAS War Crimes Investigation Team tried to pinpoint the location of Gestapo officers who were wanted for a host of atrocities.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the vast and diverse continent, aiming to show its landscapes and wildlife as they have never been seen before. He begins in the Kalahari desert, Africa's south-west corner, where clever meerkats are outsmarted by a wily bird's use of mimicry, a solitary rhino is seen to exhibit previously unknown sociable behaviours, terrifying insects prey on baby birds and the rarest fish in the world is filmed for the first time. In the neighbouring Namib desert, which receives almost no rain, the competition for scant resources can be fierce, as proven by a ferocious fight for supremacy between two giraffes.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough continues his exploration of the continent in east Africa, which is a haven for life and supports a higher density of large mammals than anywhere else on Earth. From dense forests to snow-capped peaks, steamy swamps to endless savannah, it's also a land of unpredictable extremes, where creatures must adapt to survive. In Tanzania, a tiny lizard risks its life to eat flies from the face of a sleepy lion. The nesting habits of the 4ft shoebill are also captured on camera - the giant bird has two chicks, but due to sibling rivalry only one will survive. On the plains of Amboseli, a baby elephant is near to death in the drought, so its mother leaves the herd to stay with her offspring until the bitter end.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the varied creatures of the Congo rainforest, one of the most competitive habitats on Earth. A sweet-toothed chimpanzee uses a complex array of tools to access honey from a beehive, the elusive picathartes bird feeds unsuspecting frogs to its dinosaur-like chicks and a massive female python reveals her maternal side as she sunbathes to incubate her eggs. Tiny leaf-folding frogs battle it out kung fu style, and as darkness falls the forest elephants gather to face their rivals.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough describes some of the wildlife spectacles of southern Africa, starting out in a little-explored rainforest discovered less than a decade ago by scientists who spotted it on satellite maps. There, thousands of butterflies dance for the right to mate, while on a tiny island off Mozambique, green turtles emerge from eggs and begin a hazardous journey to the water - with pied crows and hungry crabs eager to get them. Cameras also capture one of the largest gatherings of great white sharks on the planet as 30 of the predators circle around a dead whale.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the vast and diverse continent, aiming to show its landscapes and wildlife as they have never been seen before. He begins in the Kalahari desert, Africa's south-west corner, where clever meerkats are outsmarted by a wily bird's use of mimicry, a solitary rhino is seen to exhibit previously unknown sociable behaviours, terrifying insects prey on baby birds and the rarest fish in the world is filmed for the first time. In the neighbouring Namib desert, which receives almost no rain, the competition for scant resources can be fierce, as proven by a ferocious fight for supremacy between two giraffes.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough continues his exploration of the continent in east Africa, which is a haven for life and supports a higher density of large mammals than anywhere else on Earth. From dense forests to snow-capped peaks, steamy swamps to endless savannah, it's also a land of unpredictable extremes, where creatures must adapt to survive. In Tanzania, a tiny lizard risks its life to eat flies from the face of a sleepy lion. The nesting habits of the 4ft shoebill are also captured on camera - the giant bird has two chicks, but due to sibling rivalry only one will survive. On the plains of Amboseli, a baby elephant is near to death in the drought, so its mother leaves the herd to stay with her offspring until the bitter end.

programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the varied creatures of the Congo rainforest, one of the most competitive habitats on Earth. A sweet-toothed chimpanzee uses a complex array of tools to access honey from a beehive, the elusive picathartes bird feeds unsuspecting frogs to its dinosaur-like chicks and a massive female python reveals her maternal side as she sunbathes to incubate her eggs. Tiny leaf-folding frogs battle it out kung fu style, and as darkness falls the forest elephants gather to face their rivals.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough describes some of the wildlife spectacles of southern Africa, starting out in a little-explored rainforest discovered less than a decade ago by scientists who spotted it on satellite maps. There, thousands of butterflies dance for the right to mate, while on a tiny island off Mozambique, green turtles emerge from eggs and begin a hazardous journey to the water - with pied crows and hungry crabs eager to get them. Cameras also capture one of the largest gatherings of great white sharks on the planet as 30 of the predators circle around a dead whale.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: The secrets of the largest subterranean fortress along France's border with Germany, and a look at how a unique precious mineral was discovered in Derbyshire.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A strange-looking town with a supernatural atmosphere, a collection of imposing buildings in southern Australia, and the remains of curious-looking basins emerging from the waves.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team is under pressure with a record number of cars to auction, but Derek finds room for one more - a replica AC Cobra. A couple are reunited with their Volvo breakdown truck.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.desc: An exploration of the Harz Mountain Railway in Germany - Europe's longest rail network - which still uses steam locomotives and has a murky, hidden past.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At the South Devon Railway, Andy Leech and Liz Turner host afternoon tea for 44 passengers. In East Lancashire, volunteer Chandra Law takes on the new role of Stationmaster.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: First episode of the Glasgow-set crime drama. A murderer is on the loose, and one by one, bodies of young women are found strangled in the city. The inquiry is headed by top detective Jim Taggart, a tough local cop who has risen through the ranks and one of the new breed of graduate policemen, Peter Livingstone. However, despite their differences they work together breaking all the rules to hunt the killer before he strikes again. Mark McManus and Neil Duncan star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a political activist 15 years earlier but, just as it is getting somewhere, Ted orders the investigation to be halted and Ucos is threatened with closure following its perceived mishandling of the Hanway case. However, the team refuses to give up, and finds evidence of a cover-up involving top officials and a multi-national drugs company. Guest starring Meera Syal and Lorraine Ashbourne.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: A worrying event back home involving his wife forces Michael Stubbs contemplate his priorities. Starring Robson Green and Rob Spendlove.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Terry is beside himself with worry about his nephews' safety, convinced they are being abused by his brother, and jeopardises the case to help them. Meadows attends the funeral of former colleague Ted Roach, and is drawn into investigating the suspicious circumstances surrounding his death, helped by ex-coppers Bob Cryer and Alec Peters. Questioning his own mortality in the process, he wonders whether a quieter pace of life would suit him better, but soon realises he would miss the thrill of the job and sets off home in a more positive mood - until he gets a shooting pain down his arm.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Zubin's barely controlled jealousy leaves Jess wondering if she has made a mistake, so she decides to end her relationship with Reza. Connie is determined to show Will who's in charge, and dispatches him to a teaching course. However, Ric is concerned that her continued persecution will force him to quit. Tricia thinks Carlos wants to break up with her, but he has a surprise in store that convinces her otherwise.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Toxic fumes are released into the atmosphere when chemical additives accidentally spill while being delivered to a swimming pool, while a violent drug addict causes havoc inside an ambulance. Gloria's former lover and current landlord evicts her, and Richard experiences problems with blurred vision.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Neil speedily steps into a convalescing Jack Meadows' shoes, much to the dismay of Debbie McAllister, who takes a dim view of his unseemly haste to take over. Rob organises a disastrous raid on the Radfords' club, while Samantha receives a video of missing daughter Abi, belatedly bringing Phil Hunter round to the view that the youngster has been kidnapped.

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Andrew Davies' adaptation of Jane Austen's classic novel, starring Colin Firth, Jennifer Ehle, Alison Steadman, Benjamin Whitrow and Julia Sawalha. A wealthy eligible bachelor rents a property in Hertfordshire, causing a flurry of anticipation among the ladies of the district. However, it transpires he also brought along a friend - the haughty and aloof Fitzwilliam Darcy.

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Mrs Bennet spots an opportunity to marry off another of her daughters with the arrival of clergyman Mr Collins. However, Elizabeth is unable to take his proposal seriously, being too preoccupied with a handsome newcomer who poisons her mind further against Mr Darcy. Alison Steadman, Jennifer Ehle and David Bamber star in Andrew Davies' adaptation of Jane Austen's classic novel.

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Elizabeth visits Mr Collins once Charlotte has accepted his proposal of marriage and confides in Jane that she regards him as one of the stupidest men in England. Mrs Bennet sizes up George Wickham as a potential suitor for her daughter - but he has set his heart on society heiress Miss King.

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Rejected by Elizabeth, Darcy decides to return to Rosling Park - and resolves to reveal the truth about Wickham's character in a letter. Colin Firth, Jennifer Ehle, Alison Steadman, Benjamin Whitrow and Julia Sawalha star.

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Despite Miss Bingley's efforts to keep them apart, Darcy and Elizabeth's relationship grows more affectionate - until bad news arrives from Longbourn about Lydia and Wickham. Jane Austen adaptation, starring Jennifer Ehle, Colin Firth and Julia Sawalha.

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Wickham's elopement with Lydia makes Elizabeth see him for what he really is, while Bingley proposes to Jane - an offer she readily accepts. Colin Firth and Jennifer Ehle star.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest investigates when a body is found at the stone circle in a polio-stricken village, leading him to conclude that dark forces are involved - and another sacrifice could be imminent. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: The president of the local cricket club is found shot dead in the middle of the pitch after a recent victory. Suspicion falls on his family and fellow players, but all of them have an alibi. JP thinks Dwayne is keeping something from him and wonders how well he knows his friend, and Humphrey dreads Martha's imminent departure from the island.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team looks into the death of a terrorist 30 years previously after his daughter receives an anonymous note claiming he was murdered - an investigation that takes them right back to the Greenham Common anti-nuclear protests. Meanwhile, Sasha agrees to go for dinner with her ex-husband Ned, which he is hoping will lead to a reconciliation. Tamzin Outhwaite and Dennis Waterman star, with guest appearances from Barnaby Kay, Charlotte Cornwell and Patricia Potter.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Jim and the team investigate when a dismembered body is found under the floorboards of a Glasgow house. Things take a turn for the worse when the victim's nine-month-old baby is kidnapped from a multi-storey car park. Drama, starring Mark McManus, Neil Duncan, Harriet Buchan and Robert Robertson.

programme.title: New Year's Eve
programme.desc: Join Anna Botting and the Sky News team in London and Edinburgh as we gear up for Big Ben striking midnight to mark the end of 2019.

programme.title: New Year's Eve
programme.desc: Join Anna Botting and the Sky News team in London and Edinburgh as we gear up for Big Ben striking midnight to mark the end of 2019.

programme.title: New Year's Eve
programme.desc: Join Anna Botting and the Sky News team in London and Edinburgh as we gear up for Big Ben striking midnight to mark the end of 2019.

programme.title: Sky News on the Hour
programme.desc: Review of the latest international news, with sport, weather and financial updates.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: The Pledge

programme.title: Sean's Very Scottish Hogmanay
programme.desc: Sean Batty presents a Hogmanay celebration from Craufurdland Castle in Ayrshire, featuring fireworks, ceilidh dancing and Scottish traditions, old and new. Music is provided by singer-songrwriter Dougie MacLean and folk singer Mairi Campbell.

programme.title: Alan Carr's Celebrity Re-Play 2019
programme.desc: The comedian and chat show host is joined by six celebrity guests for a special games night as they look back at some of the most memorable moments of the past 12 months, from Stormzy's spectacular Glastonbury set to England almost winning the Rugby World Cup and Boris Johnson's failed attempt to shut down Parliament. Angellica Bell joins Alan in overseeing proceedings, which features a mixture of comedy moments, surprise guests, and one famous couple having the chance to win Â£25,000 for charity.

programme.title: Uncle Buck (1989)
programme.desc: An unreliable but good-natured slob is called upon to look after his trouble-making nephew and nieces while their parents are away - and what starts as a disaster soon changes for the better as the unlikely babysitter gets to grips with the finer points of being a responsible adult. Family comedy, starring John Candy, Macaulay Culkin, Jean Kelly, Gaby Hoffman, Amy Madigan and Laurie Metcalf.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania
programme.desc: Mavis tries to prove she can care for a living creature by rescuing a bad egg.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania
programme.desc: The kids try to watch the last episode of their favourite show, Hotel Pennsylvania.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Gran accidentally wins a board game as a Bingo prize, and after being locked up for years the game has a vendetta all of its own..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Betty wants a nice photo of Dave and Anna, but the camera George uses happens to belong to Gran, and it's been cursed by an ancient mummy..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Weasel tends to Fizz's toothache, but Magoo turns up, thinking he's busting into an animal testing lab..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Busy observing the sky in search of UFOs, Magoo accidentally finds himself wandering over to Fizz's house..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo, hunting for Pinkbeard's treasure, mistakes the park for an island. Fizz and Weasel are there, selling ice cream that never falls on the ground..

programme.title: Britain's Favourite Walks: Top 100
programme.desc: Julia Bradbury and Ore Oduba present a countdown of the UK's best loved walks, voted for by more than 8,000 enthusiasts. Featuring locations from the West Highland Way to the Ridgeway, and almost everywhere in between. Famous faces including Catherine Tyldesley, Adrian Edmondson, Katherine Kelly, Larry Lamb, Janet Street Porter and Robert Bathurst hit the trails to reveal their own favourite walks, which feature in the poll. They are joined by experts, nature aficionados and members of the public who provide an insight into the hikes, the history and the hidden stories behind the trails.

programme.title: Countrywise
programme.desc: The programme explores what makes this time of the year so special in Britain's countryside. Ben Fogle climbs Helvellyn with a man who battles the elements in the Lake District every day, while Paul Heiney views the Peak District from a glider and Liz Bonnin witnesses thousands of swans begin their journey from the fens of Cambridgeshire to their winter home in Russia.

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.sub-title: Racing on STV: Live from Cheltenham
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of the 1.25 888 Sport Dipper Novices' Steeple Chase from Cheltenham, which is followed by races at 2.00, 2.35 and 3.10. Plus, races from 1.40 and 3.10 at Musselburgh. With analysis from Mick Fitzgerald and Luke Harvey, reports by Alice Plunkett and Matt Chapman, and commentary from Richard Hoiles.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers, including footage of a golfer being surprised by an alligator, a child being fired into a belfry, and a restaurant receiving an unexpected guest through their ceiling.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Paul, Josie, OJ and Barry pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Nicola, Chris and Elysia compete to guess the phrases hidden in animated clues, but only one of them will go through to the Super Catchphrase round for the chance to win Â£50,000

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: While Victoria is full of love for her new baby, Aaron is downbeat about the year ahead, and Liam is in denial.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Tracy wakes up naked and hungover, and realises she has cheated on Steve. As she and her latest flame row in the street, Amy approaches and realises with horror who her mum has spent that night with. There's a stand-off at the factory as the events of Christmas Day overshadow the new year.

programme.title: Bancroft
programme.desc: Promoted to Detective Chief Superintendent, Bancroft has professional success but at great personal cost. When a double murder brings an unexpected reunion, Elizabeth is forced onto the sidelines by Detective Superintendent Jake Harper. However, as new enemies emerge, old foes make their move. Thriller, starring Sarah Parish, David Avery, Charlotte Hope, Adam Long and Lee Boardman.

programme.title: The Hangover (2009)
programme.desc: Three men on a stag weekend in Las Vegas wake up after a night of heavy drinking and find they have not only misplaced the groom, but somehow gained a tiger and a baby. Unable to remember the details of the night before, they set about piecing the clues together in the hope of finding their missing friend. Comedy, starring Bradley Cooper, Ed Helms and Zach Galifianakis.

programme.title: FBI's 10 Most Wanted
programme.desc: The FBI's Most Wanted list has proved one of their most effective weapons in catching criminals. This documentary look at the origin of the famous list, which has included the train robber Tommy Holden, kidnapper Ruth Eisemann, murderer Ted Bundy and terrorist Osama Bin Laden.

programme.title: Extreme Drug Smuggling
programme.desc: How police tackle the radical techniques used by drug smugglers to move their product, including submarines and impressive tunnels, and whether they can ever be defeated.

programme.title: Al Murray's Great British Pub Quiz
programme.desc: Al, aided by barman Shaun Williamson and captains Andy Parsons and Ed Byrne, oversees the clash between The Carlyon Arms from St Austell, Cornwall, and The King's Head from Crouch End, north London.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Real-life footage of road-based disasters, including hair-raising near misses, high-octane police chases and disastrous car accidents.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Real-life footage of road-based disasters, including hair-raising near misses, high-octane police chases and disastrous car accidents.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A windsurfer is hit by a huge wave, a firefighter is almost crushed by a falling church steeple and a driver falls asleep and crashes into a petrol station.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: An oil tanker blaze causes huge explosions, a skier falls hundreds of feet down a mountain, a pilot crash-lands on an aircraft carrier and a crane drops its load on to a car.

programme.title: Swamp Loggers
programme.desc: Bobby Goodson is admitted to hospital and it is unclear how long he will be out of action, while quotas halt the crew's relocation to a fresh tract.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: A woman who has suffered from a serious illness is presented with her new and improved Dodge Magnum.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The artisan restorers revive a rare and valuable fairground ride, then resuscitate a Victorian park bench and a century-old gentleman's suitcase.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The artisan restorers save a quirky counter, a 100-piece chandelier and a vintage football table. Plus, a 100-year-old shop counter is rescued from a bonfire.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: A fancy fairground waltzer, an ancient coffee machine and a huge oak table are restored in the workshops of some of the UK's most celebrated crafts people.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The artisan restorers revamp a fragile standing mirror needing some love, a classic armchair and a large railway station clock. Rebecca Pritchard examines their origins.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard pushes his haggling skills to the limit as he bids for items at St Mary's School in Worcester. The expert salvager is like a child in a sweet shop - but can he come away with the goods?.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard hopes to discover desirable collectibles during a visit to an imposing gothic castle in Ireland.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Ace salvager Drew Pritchard is always on the lookout for stock for his show room. Here, he visits a man who is renovating his family's country house, hoping there will be bargains on offer.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard stumbles across a vintage exercise bike while scouring a props warehouse in Liverpool.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Staffordshire, modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard gains access to a private collection of a pub owner, who has been hoarding antiques for over half a century.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Lincolnshire, modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard visits a 16th-century Elizabethan mansion and hits the jackpot at a brewery.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Frank Fritz jumps for joy as he and Mike Wolfe pick a recently closed toy museum that is ready to sell its collection of treasures.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: While free-styling in Virginia's Appalachian Mountains, 'pickers' Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz come across a hideaway filled with history - and even some mementos from a bluegrass legend.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: In Michigan, Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz find a 1985 Cadillac, but what they really want is a pump. Then, they're shown a barn-fresh 1931 Ford Model A tow truck that is so rare it could be worth a small fortune.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Pickers Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz find a massive warehouse in Chicago filled with cast-off treasures, including some superstar sports memorabilia that are a 'total slam dunk'.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: At a Hampshire auction room, Drew Pritchard has the pick of over 500 items from affluent private homes. In Lancaster he is reminded of his passion for Elvis memorabilia.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League, including West Bromwich Albion v Leeds United and Huddersfield Town v Stoke City.

programme.title: The Cannibal in the Jungle
programme.desc: The story of an American scientist who was convicted of killing and cannibalising two colleagues in the jungles of Flores, Indonesia, in 1977.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: Featuring a Chinese woman battling an ageing condition, three Filipino brothers who can never grow, an all-dwarf soccer team in Brazil, and a teen with only half a body.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: Unspeakable crimes solved with the help of CCTV, focusing on the case of two Florida parents brutally gunned down. Investigators had to rely on surveillance cameras to catch the killers and bring them to justice.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The death of 16-year-old Skylar Neese, whose remains were found in January 2013, six months after she was reported missing from her West Virginia home. Rachel Shoaf pleaded guilty to second-degree murder, telling authorities that she and fellow teenager, Shelia Eddy, planned and carried out Neese's murder.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Sometimes blood relations lead to bloodshed - when murder becomes a family affair. Here, investigators turn to forensics to uncover sinister plots within families.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The nationwide manhunt for serial killer Christopher Wilder, who posed as a fashion photographer to lure unsuspecting victims to his Florida estate. As the net closed in, Wilder went on a cross-country rampage, and it was thanks to a TV campaign that he was finally brought to justice.

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: Animal welfare officers working for the Michigan Humane Society recall cases in which animals made amazing recoveries.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown, one of Sydney's busiest veterinarians, performs a state-of-the-art operation on an out-of-control bulldog.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Australian vet Chris Brown comes to the aid of a golden retriever and a record-breaking goat.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The store holds a three-hour sale, and over 200 women flood the store looking for the perfect dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Two friends want the same dress for their wedding, while another pair of customers try to keep their gowns secret from each other.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A bride and her mother who are both over six feet tall struggle to find dresses for the big day. A customer who has tried more than 80 gowns still cannot make up her mind.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: An American football player puts a limit on his sister's budget when she takes a liking to an expensive dress, and a designer has very specific ideas for her friend's gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Country singer Jerrod Niemann's fiancee visits the shop, and the mother of another customer is determined to see her daughter in white.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A bride who chose to elope tries to make peace with her parents by involving them in her choice of dress. Another customer wants a gown fit for a queen.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A bride wants a look inspired by her favourite singer, and another customer finds her ideas being undermined by her opinionated entourage.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A father and fiance have very different ideas about a bride's dress, and a customer wants a simple gown while her family favour something more spectacular.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Two customers want to wear fancy dresses for their big days - but the mother of one and the brother of the other have different ideas.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: With just weeks until her big day, Lisa has brought her opinionated fiance to the store. Plus, Christina's long-distance engagement has left her friends weary.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: After a horrific accident, Katie was told that thanks to a terrible injury she would never walk again. Unwilling to accept her fate, she is determined to walk down the aisle in her dream dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: WNBA star Glory Johnson brings her fiance WNBA player Brittney Griner to help find a wedding dress. However, it's not all fun and games for Glory as the pressure rises.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: When the Leading Man Takes a Stand
programme.desc: A bride who relies on her grandfather's advice may go home empty-handed when she takes a liking to a dress that is over her budget.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Milla is still completely dependent on her children - will she finally lose enough weight to be able to walk? Plus, Charity struggles to reach goal weight.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: After losing over 200 pounds, Doug is now an active part of his family's lives. However, his eating disorder is once again threatening to derail his progress.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Pauline's self-destructive behaviour continues to be a problem. While Chad continues his journey, June's progress stalls when she slips back into bad habits.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.sub-title: My Birth Certificate Reads 'Jane Doe' - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Children adopted out as babies search for their birth families, hoping to find or forge connections to their kin. Hosted by Chris Jacobs and Lisa Joyner.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.sub-title: This Isn't the Way It Was Supposed to Be
programme.desc: A woman hears vexing news about her biological father, but exciting information on his family. Plus, Leslie and her birth mother Janice seek therapy.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Former plus-size model and 'big is beautiful' advocate Renee now realises her mortal mistakes, as her weight swells to 600lb and her health crumbles.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: A mother with no arms, a girl whose tongue keeps growing, a South African woman with giant legs and the residents of a village in Brazil who live in fear of the sun.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.sub-title: Boy with a Tail: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: Featuring a boy from India who has a tail, an eight-foot tall teenager, a man with supersized muscles and a 'lobster woman'.
